sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content:
Pic.Height returns the width in pixels of the picture represented by picID.

This function is often used in conjunction with Pic.Width to obtain the dimensions of a picture loaded using Pic.FileNew.
sections.mdown_content:
**Pic.Height **returns the width in pixels of the picture 
represented by *picID*.
This function is often used in conjunction with **Pic.Width** 
to obtain the dimensions of a picture loaded using 
**Pic.FileNew**.

sections.title: Example
code:
var pic : int := Pic.FileNew ("lighthouse.jpg")
        var width : int := Pic.Width (pic)
        var height : int := Pic.Height (pic)
        var x, y : int := 0
        loop
            exit when y > maxy
            loop
                exit when x > maxx
                Pic.Draw (pic, x, y, picCopy)
                x := x + width
            end loop
            x := 0
            y := y + height
        end loop
sections.raw_content:
The program draws loads a picture from the file lighthouse.jpg and proceeds to tile the entire run window with copies of the picture.

Output of Example Program
sections.mdown_content:
The program draws loads a picture from the file *lighthouse.jpg* 
and proceeds to tile the entire run window with copies of the 
picture.


**Output of Example Program**

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Pic.Height, not by calling Height.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling 
**Pic.Height**, not by calling **Height**.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content: Pic.Width to obtain a picture's width and Pic.FileNew to load a picture from a graphics file.
sections.mdown_content:
**[pic_width.html](Pic.Width)** to obtain a picture's 
width and **[pic_filenew.html](Pic.FileNew)** to load 
a picture from a graphics file.
